title: Oscar Futures: Can Parasite Worm Its Way Into Best Picture?
text:
Up

Parasite

After winning the Palme d’Or, becoming a box-office sensation in South Korea, and thrilling festival audiences at Telluride and TIFF, Bong Joon-ho’s class satire hits theaters in New York and Los Angeles this week, and American viewers finally get to see what all the fuss is about. With Bong’s film boasting an immaculate 100 percent fresh rating and dozens of sold-out showings, hopes are high that Parasite will be able to compete in all the major categories. Last year Roma reconfigured the conventional wisdom on what a foreign-language film could accomplish, though that movie had the full weight of Netflix’s resources behind it. Team Parasite will have to hope that Neon, an indie distributor that has never cracked Best Picture, can handle the gauntlet.
